# Development notes

## Getting JNI method signature

To get the JNI signature of a method located in say `Grug.java`, use `javap -s bin/main/grug/grugmodloader/Grug.class`.

To get the full signature, copy the method to a new `foo.java` file:

```java
public class foo {
    public native boolean BlockEntity_has_on_tick(long onFns);
    public native void BlockEntity_on_tick(long onFns, byte[] globals);
}
```

and run `javac -h . foo.java` to generate its header:

```c
/* DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE - it is machine generated */
#include <jni.h>
/* Header for class foo */

#ifndef _Included_foo
#define _Included_foo
#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif
/*
 * Class:     foo
 * Method:    BlockEntity_has_on_tick
 * Signature: (J)Z
 */
JNIEXPORT jboolean JNICALL Java_foo_block_1entity_1has_1on_1tick
  (JNIEnv *, jobject, jlong);

/*
 * Class:     foo
 * Method:    BlockEntity_on_tick
 * Signature: (J[B)V
 */
JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_foo_block_1entity_1on_1tick
  (JNIEnv *, jobject, jlong, jbyteArray);

#ifdef __cplusplus
}
#endif
#endif
```
